|rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL |rad2txchains = 2 |rad2rxchains = 2 |rad2sstreams = 2 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n |rad2n = 300 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5 |rad3chip1 = Atheros;AR9582;AR9582-AR1A; |rad3oui = |rad3_ant_conn = U.FL |rad3txchains = 2 |rad3rxchains = 2 |rad3sstreams = 2 |rad3stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad3n = 300 |rad3g = 54 |rad3b = 11 |rad3freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== This is a three radio device (11b/g/n, 11a/n, 11a/b/g/n [Air Marshall?]). :It would ''appear'' to be using [[Atheros]] silicon (AR9344 + AR???? (AR9382 / AR9582?) + AR9374?)[[Senao CAP4200AG]] ?? The FCC EUT has a MAC address starting with 00:18:0A. It's presumed to be used. ==Links of Interest== *https://meraki.cisco.com/lib/pdf/meraki_datasheet_MR18.pdf ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/meraki/meraki_mr18 |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/meraki/mr18 |forumpage = https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=59248 |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = |subtarget = |arch = |support_started_version = 17.01.0 |current_supported_version = 23.05.2 |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = }} 
Hardware
Architecture: MIPS
Vendor: Atheros/Qualcomm
System-On-Chip: Atheros/Qualcomm QCA9557-AT4A
CPU Speed: 720MHz
Flash size: SK hynix 128MiB NAND
RAM: 2x Unknown DDR2 64MiB
Wireless: SoC AR9550 + 2x Atheros AR9582-AR1A
Switch: None
Ethernet port: 1x Gigabit AR8035-A, 802.3af PoE capable
USB: No
Serial: Yes, 115200 8N1, left to right: VCC/RX/TX/GND
JTAG: Yes, EJTAG 1.2
Bootloader: nandloader (Cisco made)
Please insert instructions here ==Pictures==
